post_title: Positive vibes, fast pace and family oriented
text: Pros: Staff wellbeing & wellness are being taken care of. Organisation always believe that all their employees are good. Clarity of our career pathway. Good colleagues and very respectful.. Cons: Always busy all year round - back to back events and programmes.
Pros: Good slaray structure paid higher than the market rate. Cons: HR does not look into matters deeply and biasness is the key to success for all hierarchys in this organisation.

post_title: Be careful with the company, management and backstabbing colleagues.
text: Pros: Medical benefits is the only thing thatâ€™s good. Cons: Toxic management, such a parent pleaser. Lick boot kind mindset Some colleagues are competitive unnecessarily when we should be working together Management will expect you to break sweat and bone for the job HR has zero understanding towards employees.

Pros: benefits and literally nothing else. Cons: - work-life balance is non-existent - principal and dcl are basically like vultures waiting for something to happen so they can swoop down and reprimand you - for those that seeks a centre that would bring out your creative side, DON'T come here. everything has to be done in a specific way, down to the fonts used when printing display words in class. - higher ups don't care about mental health, it's more of "We have a gift for you!" and just stuff your face with presents and benefits BUT it's not worth it.
Pros: Good colleague and able to communicate well. Cons: No disadvantages are that i find
